attributes.action: Provide support to all families hit by tax credits cuts
attributes.additional_details:
Around 148,000 North East families currently receive child tax credit, according to the Office for National Statistics and according to the Resolution Foundation, more than a million households will lose an average of £1,350 a year.  Before implementing such an unfriendly bill effecting the minimum wage earners and make their life more difficult with rising rents and deposits, government should provide alternatives

Susannah Fuhrmann - Blogger at: http://cheapautoinsurance.net
attributes.background: Recent tax credit cut bill might be in the interest of the nation and it does not seem to be the right solution.

rejection.details:
We're not sure what alternative support you would like the UK Government or Parliament to offer.

You could consider starting a petition asking for the changes to tax credits to be reversed, or for a specific form of support to be offered as an alternative.
